unnormalised: ## Chasing the Viral Dragon: What's Hot in Social Media Today?
normalised: ## Chasing the Viral Dragon: What's Hot in Social Media Today?

unnormalised: Hey guys! Ever felt like you're scrolling through Instagram and suddenly BAM! Everyone's doing the same dance, using the same filter, or quoting the same dialogue from some obscure movie? That, my friends, is the elusive beast we call virality. And in the world of social media and influencer marketing, catching that dragon is the ultimate goal.

And in the world of social media and influencer marketing, catching that dragon is the ultimate goal.

unnormalised: But the landscape is shifting faster than a Delhi auto rickshaw dodging traffic! What was trending yesterday – say, the "Rasode Mein Kaun Tha" meme from 2020 – is ancient history today. So, what's grabbing eyeballs right now?
normalised: But the landscape is shifting faster than a Delhi auto rickshaw dodging traffic! What was trending yesterday – say, the "Rasode Mein Kaun Tha" meme from two thousand and twenty – is ancient history today. So, what is grabbing eyeballs right now?

unnormalised: One thing I've noticed is the rise of hyper-localized content. Think videos of pani puri challenges in Chandni Chowk, reels showcasing the best street style in Bandra, or even explainers on the latest RBI policy, tailored for the Gen Z investor. People are craving content that's relatable and speaks directly to their experiences, their "Indian-ness," if you will.

unnormalised: Another trend? Authenticity. Gone are the days of perfectly curated Instagram feeds. People are gravitating towards influencers like Prajakta Koli, who keep it real, showing their struggles alongside their successes. This shift aligns with the "BeReal" app's success, even though it launched sometime around 2022 and still has momentum in 2024.

unnormalised: Challenges are still HUGE. But they need a twist! The Ice Bucket Challenge was ages ago, but now, people want challenges that are fun, engaging, and maybe even have a social cause attached. Remember the "Kiki Challenge" from back in the day? A contemporary version would need a relevant Indian flavor and a clear call to action.

unnormalised: So, how do you predict the next viral trend? Honestly, it's part art, part science, and a whole lotta luck! Pay attention to the conversations happening online, experiment with different formats, and most importantly, stay true to your brand. Oh, and mark your calendars, 15/08/1947 will always be a date that trends, no matter the year!
